dfn-ttscancel.summary: The cancel() method of the SpeechSynthesis interface removes all utterances from the utterance queue.
dfn-ttscancel.title: SpeechSynthesis.cancel()

dfn-ttsgetvoices.summary: The getVoices() method of the SpeechSynthesis interface returns a list of SpeechSynthesisVoice objects representing all the available voices on the current device.
dfn-ttsgetvoices.title: SpeechSynthesis.getVoices()

dfn-ttsonvoiceschanged.summary: The onvoiceschanged property of the SpeechSynthesis interface represents an event handler that will run when the list of SpeechSynthesisVoice objects that would be returned by the SpeechSynthesis.getVoices() method has changed (when the voiceschanged event fires.)
dfn-ttsonvoiceschanged.title: SpeechSynthesis.onvoiceschanged

dfn-ttspause.summary: The pause() method of the SpeechSynthesis interface puts the SpeechSynthesis object into a paused state.
dfn-ttspause.title: SpeechSynthesis.pause()

dfn-ttspaused.summary: The paused read-only property of the SpeechSynthesis interface is a Boolean that returns true if the SpeechSynthesis object is in a paused state, or false if not.
dfn-ttspaused.title: SpeechSynthesis.paused

dfn-ttspending.summary: The pending read-only property of the SpeechSynthesis interface is a Boolean that returns true if the utterance queue contains as-yet-unspoken utterances.
dfn-ttspending.title: SpeechSynthesis.pending

dfn-ttsresume.summary: The resume() method of the SpeechSynthesis interface puts the SpeechSynthesis object into a non-paused state: resumes it if it was already paused.
dfn-ttsresume.title: SpeechSynthesis.resume()

dfn-ttsspeak.summary: The speak() method of the SpeechSynthesis interface adds an utterance to the utterance queue; it will be spoken when any other utterances queued before it have been spoken.
dfn-ttsspeak.title: SpeechSynthesis.speak()

dfn-ttsspeaking.summary: The speaking read-only property of the SpeechSynthesis interface is a Boolean that returns true if an utterance is currently in the process of being spoken — even if SpeechSynthesis is in a paused state.
dfn-ttsspeaking.title: SpeechSynthesis.speaking

dfn-utterancelang.summary: The lang property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface gets and sets the language of the utterance.
dfn-utterancelang.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.lang

dfn-utteranceonboundary.summary: The onboundary property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface represents an event handler that will run when the spoken utterance reaches a word or sentence boundary (when the boundary event fires.)
dfn-utteranceonboundary.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onboundary

dfn-utteranceonend.summary: The onend property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface represents an event handler that will run when the utterance has finished being spoken (when the end event fires.)
dfn-utteranceonend.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onend

dfn-utteranceonerror.summary: The onerror property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface represents an event handler that will run when an error occurs that prevents the utterance from being succesfully spoken (when the error event fires.)
dfn-utteranceonerror.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onerror

dfn-utteranceonmark.summary: The onmark property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface represents an event handler that will run when the spoken utterance reaches a named SSML mark tag (when the mark event fires.)
dfn-utteranceonmark.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onmark

dfn-utteranceonpause.summary: The onpause property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface represents an event handler that will run when the utterance is paused part way through (when the pause event fires.)
dfn-utteranceonpause.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onpause

dfn-utteranceonresume.summary: The onresume property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface represents an event handler that will run when a paused utterance is resumed (when the resume event fires.)
dfn-utteranceonresume.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onresume

dfn-utteranceonstart.summary: The onstart property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface represents an event handler that will run when the utterance has begun to be spoken (when the start event fires.)
dfn-utteranceonstart.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onstart

dfn-utterancepitch.summary: The pitch property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface gets and sets the pitch at which the utterance will be spoken at.
dfn-utterancepitch.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.pitch

dfn-utterancerate.summary: The rate property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface gets and sets the speed at which the utterance will be spoken at.
dfn-utterancerate.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.rate

dfn-utterancetext.summary: The text property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface gets and sets the text that will be synthesised when the utterance is spoken.
dfn-utterancetext.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.text

dfn-utterancevoice.summary: The voice property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface gets and sets the voice that will be used to speak the utterance.
dfn-utterancevoice.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.voice

dfn-utterancevolume.summary: The volume property of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface gets and sets the volume that the utterance will be spoken at.
dfn-utterancevolume.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.volume

dfn-voicedefault.summary: The default read-only property of the SpeechSynthesisVoice interface returns a Boolean indicating whether the voice is the default voice for the current app (true), or not (false.)
dfn-voicedefault.title: SpeechSynthesisVoice.default

dfn-voicelang.summary: The lang read-only property of the SpeechSynthesisVoice interface returns a BCP 47 language tag indicating the language of the voice.
dfn-voicelang.title: SpeechSynthesisVoice.lang

dfn-voicelocalservice.summary: The localService read-only property of the SpeechSynthesisVoice interface returns a Boolean indicating whether the voice is supplied by a local speech synthesizer service (true), or a remote speech synthesizer service (false.)
dfn-voicelocalservice.title: SpeechSynthesisVoice.localService

dfn-voicename.summary: The name read-only property of the SpeechSynthesisVoice interface returns a human-readable name that represents the voice.
dfn-voicename.title: SpeechSynthesisVoice.name

dfn-voicevoiceuri.summary: The voiceURI read-only property of the SpeechSynthesisVoice interface returns the type of URI and location of the speech synthesis service for this voice.
dfn-voicevoiceuri.title: SpeechSynthesisVoice.voiceURI

chrome.notes: You'll need to serve your code through a web server for recognition to work.

chrome_android.notes: You'll need to serve your code through a web server for recognition to work.

speechreco-section.title: SpeechRecognition

speechreco-speechgrammar.summary: The SpeechGrammar interface of the Web Speech API represents a set of words or patterns of words that we want the recognition service to recognize.

firefox.notes: Note that currently only the speech synthesis part is available in Firefox Desktop — the speech recognition part will be available soon, once the required internal permissions are sorted out.

speechreco-speechgrammar.title: SpeechGrammar

speechreco-speechgrammar.summary: The SpeechGrammar interface of the Web Speech API represents a set of words or patterns of words that we want the recognition service to recognize.

firefox.notes: Note that currently only the speech synthesis part is available in Firefox Desktop — the speech recognition part will be available soon, once the required internal permissions are sorted out.

speechreco-speechgrammar.title: SpeechGrammar

speechreco-speechgrammarlist.summary: The SpeechGrammarList() constructor creates a new SpeechGrammarList object instance.

chrome.notes: You'll need to serve your code through a web server for recognition to work.

chrome_android.notes: You'll need to serve your code through a web server for recognition to work.

webview_android.notes: You'll need to serve your code through a web server for recognition to work.

speechreco-speechgrammarlist.title: SpeechGrammarList.SpeechGrammarList()

speechsynthesiserrorevent.summary: The SpeechSynthesisErrorEvent interface of the Web Speech API contains information about any errors that occur while processing SpeechSynthesisUtterance objects in the speech service.
speechsynthesiserrorevent.title: SpeechSynthesisErrorEvent

speechsynthesisevent.summary: The SpeechSynthesisEvent interface of the Web Speech API contains information about the current state of SpeechSynthesisUtterance objects that have been processed in the speech service.
speechsynthesisevent.title: SpeechSynthesisEvent

speechsynthesisvoice.summary: The SpeechSynthesisVoice interface of the Web Speech API represents a voice that the system supports. Every SpeechSynthesisVoice has its own relative speech service including information about language, name and URI.
speechsynthesisvoice.title: SpeechSynthesisVoice

tts-section.summary: The SpeechSynthesis interface of the Web Speech API is the controller interface for the speech service; this can be used to retrieve information about the synthesis voices available on the device, start and pause speech, and other commands besides.
tts-section.title: SpeechSynthesis

tts-section.summary: The SpeechSynthesisUtterance() constructor of the SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface returns a new SpeechSynthesisUtterance object instance.
tts-section.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance.SpeechSynthesisUtterance()

tts-section.summary: The speechSynthesis read-only property of the Window object returns a SpeechSynthesis object, which is the entry point into using Web Speech API speech synthesis functionality.
tts-section.title: Window.speechSynthesis

utterance-attributes.summary: The SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface of the Web Speech API represents a speech request. It contains the content the speech service should read and information about how to read it (e.g. language, pitch and volume.)
utterance-attributes.title: SpeechSynthesisUtterance
